website_summaries.verdict: Consumers can't stop raving about the fact that these boots require little to no break-in. Delivers superior performance on hikes of any length.
pros: Won't slow anyone down during inclement weather thanks to a superior waterproof exterior
A comfy lightweight construction promises long-lasting comfort
cons: You'll probably need a larger size than usual as this boot tends to run small

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking Boots
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots. I broke them in on a 5 mile hike in Shenandoah National Park one mile of which was pretty serious rock scrambling. The boots had great traction on the rocks. We got caught in a downpour and had to walk two miles back to the car on a steep incline up wet rocks and I didn’t slip at all. I wear a 7.5 or 8 and went with the 8 in these and they fit as expected.
customer_reviews.author: L. Van Tol

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Just returned from a 9 day hiking trip out west. I got these the day before we left so no "breaking them in". I have plantar fasciitis in one foot and some lower back issues. These were THE MOST COMFORTABLE SHOES that I have. As good as my Asic tennis shoes. My feet did not hurt the whole trip. These are sturdy for climbing, jumping and walking. I could not be more pleased. They gripped well on slick rock as well as in sand.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Okay but not great
customer_reviews.text: A bit disappointed in these boots. They're a bit too narrow for my toes. Keen has a really great wide toe box design for many for their shoes and boots but unfortunately these do not have that specific design. It's a real subtle design but one that makes it extremely comfortable for those with a wide toe area. It would be nice of Keen to mention this in their description for the different shoes. It almost makes a form fit around your toes area. The Presidio shoes are an example of this. Other than this problem for me, they are the usual Keen sturdy hikers. I'll wear them for shorter hikes or walks only.
customer_reviews.author: Sly F

customer_reviews.title: Sizing changed, can't wear it
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Keen Targhee boots for many years, but had to return these because the sizing is different and they were painful in my forefoot even though they were long enough. Apparently they're narrower across the metatarsal arch than other Targhee styles. I formerly wore size 9.5, so I tried a 10 and still had the metatarsal arch pain. I returned them and got a different Targhee, the EXP mid, which has a different type of sole. The fit is good with the EXP.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Esch

customer_reviews.title: Tons of toe box room. Really comfortable, really durable, great tread
customer_reviews.text: Best hiking shoes I've ever owned. Now I chose them because they were said to be the best for bunions/bone deformity and they definitely give me the room I need for that and quite a bit of cushion under the ball of the foot. But don't expect to just magically not be in pain after a hike. Maybe if there was even more cushion. I'll probably just pick up a little ball of foot hell cushion to throw in there. AWESOME AWESOME SHOE THOUGH. Especially if you have wide feet or want extra room around the the toe box area.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Timmons

customer_reviews.title: Nurse With PTTD Here
customer_reviews.text: They're just what I needed! This is my second pair, and I wear them any time I need stability, like when I'm on my feet for long lengths of time and/or when I am trail walking. I even wear them at work - because I'm a nurse and I'm often on my feet for many hours at a time. I have PTTD and these were recommended to me by my physical therapist- the toe box is bigger so they don't mash my toes, the base is nice and rigid especially under my arches where I need it and it's a boot so it protects my ankles and keeps them from rolling inward.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Dameron Cote-Eagle

customer_reviews.title: TREAD PEALED OFF IN LESS THAN 8 MONTHS!
customer_reviews.text: update:2020 tried another pair giving them the benefit of the doubt-maybe my first pair was a hiccup in factory production? NOPE! Same problem and even faster this time!! Not I can catch the lace of the opposite shoe while walking as the tread is falling off.. so near tripping periodically. Throwing these out! DO NOT BUY THEM THEY ARE NOT WORTH THE $!!! Tread pealed off after less than 8 months of periodic use, and proper upkeep. Nothing extreme like mountain climbing. Mostly short walks in grassy fields or on dirt paths. Extremely disappointment with this product, for the price I'd expect it to last much longer.. everything is such junk now its ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: Dissatisfied

customer_reviews.title: I ordered what I thought was a brand new pair ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered what I thought was a brand new pair of boots. These are scratched, scuffed and have been worn. You can see the wear marks on the soles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than best
customer_reviews.text: I ordered another exact pair. What can I say other than I love them. I wear them for work but always ready for a hike too. I have wide feet with a decade case of plantar fasciitis. With these I have zero pain to very little heel pain. My ankles are not pronating too nor hurting. I am not limping and I was limping with New Balance sneakers which are expensive sneakers. And I love the color - sorta blueish purple. I feel feminine and in charge - a nice mix.
customer_reviews.author: Guardian

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, supportive, hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable right out of box. Good arch support. Excellent ankle support. I’ve owned Keen hiking boots previously, but got a size too small and couldn’t return. I endured them for 3 years and now I upped to 1/2 size larger and they are perfects. I can see keeping these a long time.
customer_reviews.author: JNB

customer_reviews.title: The first time I wore them I walked for just 3 miles and was very pleased to notice how comfortable they are
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a hike coming up end of July. The first time I wore them I walked for just 3 miles and was very pleased to notice how comfortable they are. It doesn't seem that they need to be broken in at all. They feel like slippers to me! i will see if i change my mind after my 8 hours hike end of July... the only thing i really didn't understand is all the sizes cost like $107 but mine (6.5) was $114 ?! , not a huge difference but i would love to know why that is?
customer_reviews.author: Nadine Jaques-Dalcroze

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight sturdy hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent boots and I was pleasantly surprised at how light weight they are! I did buy a half-size up following a few reviewer recommendations, and that turned out to be solid advice. I too would say to go up a half-size to be sure to have the toe room with thicker socks, especially if you suffer from bunions. They were a recommended model for bunion sufferers and that was good advice too. They are stable for hiking and the blue and charcoal is a nice combination of colors. I haven't worn them in wet hiking conditions yet, so I can't say anything about their waterproof property, but I'm looking forward to many comfortable miles in these boots!
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Best Boots!!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my 6th or 7th pair of these boots. I'm a letter carrier and dog walker and put anywhere from 6-10 miles a day on these boots. They are totally waterproof. Often after a rainy day, my feet are the only thing still dry. I love that they are made a little wider than other brands and the toe box has lots of room.
customer_reviews.author: JudyH

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and great cushioned support!
customer_reviews.text: I hiked the blue mountains in Jamaica with these boots. They provided great comfort, ankle support, and toe box space for swelling of feet. I usually have arch pain after walking an hour but these provided arch support for 4hrs. Hike took a total of 9.5hrs and was a total of 16miles long with altitude 7,600 to give you an idea of intensity. I wasn’t able to break the shoes in before the trip but there was no need to do so! This Keen model was my favorite (I’ve tried others which were too stiff). I also recommend getting a half size bigger and getting good hiking socks.
customer_reviews.author: Curlygirl

customer_reviews.title: These are the boots, look no more!
customer_reviews.text: I do love these boots. Other reviewers are right in that they are out of the box, ready to wear. No breaking in needed. The one thing I disagree with is that many reviewers said to get a 1/2 size bigger than what you would usually wear. I did that first and while they were comfortable in the 1/2 size up, something wasn't right so I ordered my correct size (9) and they fit much better. I felt like I had more control over my footing with my correct size and there is still plenty of toe room in them. If you are thinking about these, you might as well just get them.
customer_reviews.author: firecracker15

customer_reviews.title: Not what I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis. The Keen brand was recommended to me by many people (I had been wearing Ariats). When these boots went on sale, I jumped on them. Right out of the box they were comfortable. By the 2nd or 3rd day I was already shopping for insoles. To say I'm disappointed is an understatement. I manage a sanctuary for rescued donkeys and I'm on my feet up to 14 hours a day. These boots are not working for me. If your feet are problem-free, then these boots would probably work for you.
customer_reviews.author: DonkeyMom

customer_reviews.title: Scuffed up?
customer_reviews.text: I received these "new" shoes today and they are all scuffed up. I can work around that but feel like I should at least get a discount for damaged or previously returned shoes. Definitely order a half size up, maybe 2 if you plan to hike in thick socks. I will probably return these as they hurt my right foot, and I dont think the issue will resolve over time.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: My Formerly-favorite Keen Hiking Boots a Big Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Keen hiking boots for at least the past ten years. I could always depend on them to be a comfortable and supportive shoe for hiking/walking; I've logged many miles in them. The most recently ordered pair however, were a HUGE disappointment. The sole is so stiff, it feels as if I'm walking on a concrete platform. I thought I was getting a leather upper, and was dismayed to see that the interior of the boot has the words "guaranteed waterproof" written all over it (translation "vinyl"). I wondered if Keen is still the same company it's been, or perhaps a change in ownership has taken place?
customer_reviews.author: dennis oster

customer_reviews.title: terrible grip over wet/mossy rocks which is very disappointing since ...
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned, the toe is very boxy. The fit was a little larger than expected, even with my bunions and is slightly uncomfortable around my ankles because of the gap. But they're durable and of high quality for the price. Have compensated with my slightly thick Merino wool socks. Used for rocky, forested and/or slightly muddy terrain. However, terrible grip over wet/mossy rocks which is very disappointing since there's alot of that in Hawaii where I live. Probably will switch to Merrell's Moab Ventilators once I've worn out this pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Any way to give this product a minus?
customer_reviews.text: This was my third pair of these boots. I have loved them in the past. This pair was made in Thailand and had very poor workmanship. On the inside of the top of the boot there was a bunch of material in each boot. The insert for the boot had a bad wrinkle in each one. Needless to say I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: JuneSchmidt

customer_reviews.title: love these boots!
customer_reviews.text: The Targhees are the only boots I can wear. I’m very fond of its wide toe box. Other boots give me blisters on my small toe. Have worn these hiking in the Alps, in China, and in Iceland. So far, it’s still waterproof. This mid-height boot has saved me from twisting my ankle several times as I’m very prone to twisting my ankle. The tread grip is fine although I’ve experienced a few slips on loose gravel when I became very tired. The original insoles aren’t that good so I advice you to change it to enable you to walk on it comfortably all-day. Looking forward to buy the Targhee IIIs.
customer_reviews.author: Do.Re.Meee

customer_reviews.title: Not made to last
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy these. The part of the rubber sole came apart after five hikes and now I can't return them. Cheap!!! I've only had them for four months and they've been used two months. Really?!
customer_reviews.author: 207Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Nice hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Great hiking boots. Super comfortable and waterproof. The higher portion around the ankle is flexible and comfortable; I've tried on other brands where the collar was stiff and immovable, making it uncomfortable to walk. Wore my Keens right out of the box with no issues. We had temps in the teens and my feet were toasty. Nice durable actual rubber sole also (not that plastic feeling stuff.)
customer_reviews.author: Turquoise Waters

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, substantial boots with good arch support.
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these for over 10 years that I loved. I gave them to my sister after my feet grew. I bought these in a half size bigger and they fit perfectly. These boots have good arch support and keep my feet comfortable all day; no back pain or leg cramps at night. I think these boots are fairly warm, I wear wool socks and use the Targhees as winter boots but I don't think they are. I tried a pair of the kaci winter boots too and felt the Targhee is a more supportive, substantial boot. I wish they had them in brighter colors though.
customer_reviews.author: ruth e. hickmann

customer_reviews.title: As good as ever! No break in period
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of keen hiking boots. My first pair was Targhee I, I love those boots and they still look good, the same color as these. But I noticed after several years of hard use, I was starting to get hip pain when I wore them. So I ordered this new pair, worried it was the updated model and it wouldn’t be as comfortable. When they arrived I put them on and walked around the house, and within five minutes they felt like an old friend.
customer_reviews.author: china mom

customer_reviews.title: Another great Keen product!
customer_reviews.text: Another great Keen product! I have a pair of Keen hiking boots which are actually rated for cooler weather and wanted another pair for hot days when my feet sweat. Obviously, my feet still sweat on hot days but not as much. I wear these for hiking and also around our farm when walking the dogs and doing yard work. Very comfortable and waterproof as advertised. Would not hesitate to buy again but hoping they will last me a long time like all my other Keen footwear. For longer hikes I will replace the insole with my standard Superfeet hiking insole due to some heel problems.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth G.

customer_reviews.title: Great traction great support top notch comfort
customer_reviews.text: I adore these boots. I ordered a half size up after I tried them on in a store. They weren't like an old friend til I'd hiked several miles, but they were a great brand new friend right out of the box. I never got blisters or sore feet. I wore them on a few short hikes before I really put them through their paces and they passed every test thrown at them with flying colors.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Heal is coming apart.
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of Keens I bough about 12 years ago and love them. They are wearing out so I thought I would get another pair. These new Keens are not made at all like the old ones. As you can see by the pictures the heal is coming apart. They arrived that way. I am sending them back. To pay over a $100.00 for a pair of hiking boots they should be in perfect shape upon arrival.
customer_reviews.author: J L K

customer_reviews.title: I wish they looked the same as the brown pair...
customer_reviews.text: I will keep these, but they do not look the way they are depicted in the picture. The brown style has what I consider to be nubuck...almost like suede. The picture of the charcoal looked that way too. These look like plastic. I'll see if they wear as well as my last two pairs, but I will know not to trust the pictures from now on. I had to put a star rating, but there's really no way to know at this point.
customer_reviews.author: P. Tomlinson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boot, keens run big
customer_reviews.text: At first I wasn’t sure about them, Tried them on and they seemed a bit big and clunky. (Order at least a half size down.) My feet aren’t very wide, so they seemed very wide to me. (Hint, these are great for wide feet!) I wore them to garden and fell in love. They are so comfortable! No foot fatigue at all. Then I wore them mushroom hunting and hiking for hours in some really rocky, tree covered brush and difficult forest and they are AMAZING! I love them and don’t wNt to take them off.
customer_reviews.author: CVanRose3

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got these boots right before I climbed Half Dome in Yosemite. Not the best decision on my part but I did try to break them in by walking around my apartment beforehand. After the climb, my toes really hurt and the big toes still have discoloration under the nails (eww gross whatever). I didn't want to spend $100+ on my first pair of boots and, since HD, I've gotten used to them. I wear thicker socks (they're waterproof!) or sometimes put cotton balls or little socks near my toes. These have now trekked all over Thailand, the Grand Canyon, Lassen National Park, and the Moab Desert. They're not the cutest shoes but they are great quality shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Katey

customer_reviews.title: Have had these for 4 years!
customer_reviews.text: Since the other reviews didn't help much, I thought I would let the world know that these hiking boots are GREAT! Very comfortable (for my feet, anyway), definitely waterproof, hold the trail well without slipping and have held up for 4 years and still going strong. I would not ever buy another hiking boot, I am a forever Keen fan. Just came back from a very rainy hiking trip in Iceland and my feet stayed dry and I didn't slip on the trails once. My only complaint is I can no longer find them in the cool mineral blue color!!
customer_reviews.author: AGR710

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking boots in 45 years of hard core hiking
customer_reviews.text: Just wore these boots to hike the rocky West Highland Way in Scotland, and I was one of the few people we met in 8 days who was not having blister and foot problems. I am wearing them now to hike 100+ miles in high country Colorado. Am on my third pair; so that says it all. I have wide feet, and wear the same size as for regular shoes. The wide keen toe box is fabulous, without the heel being wide. For super rocky terrain, I add a sorbithane padded insole. These boots work best with light wool hiking socks - summer or winter. Did I mention I snow shoe in these as well?
customer_reviews.author: Jackie S

customer_reviews.title: By that I mean that the top of my big toe felt like it was hitting the top of the boot when ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered my standard size, 7.5, and they felt much too tight. By that I mean that the top of my big toe felt like it was hitting the top of the boot when I walked. Not wanting to get a blister under my toe nail, I returned the boot and replaced it with a size 8. In hindsight this wasn't a good decision as the boot stretched out quite a bit, such that my foot slipped around so much I got a blister. Bottom line is the length of the shoe was probably fine but the width was too loose in the bigger size when the shoe loosened up.
customer_reviews.author: Mark F. Sebald

customer_reviews.title: Too soon to fray at seams
customer_reviews.text: Love the fit as I have wide feet. I've been very happy with Keen sandles which have worn well. I wore these boots on a few walks before using them for day hiking in the mountains. After only 5 full days of hiking , the top fabric is fraying along seams on both boots as shown in the photos. I'm very disappointed so will be contacting the manufacter as I'm quite certain they won't hold up.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: I took the advice offered and ordered a half size larger and they fit perfect. They are a little heavy but good for ...
customer_reviews.text: So comfy. I have plantar fasciitis and need to walk for exercise. Sneakers usually don't have enough support and stretch causing my feet to move around in the shoe without support. These hiking boots offer even support and hold my feet in place (I have slender feet, so I need a shoe that won't allow my feet to move around in the shoe). I took the advice offered and ordered a half size larger and they fit perfect. They are a little heavy but good for my calves. I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Education

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Pro: water proof, walked through some water that came over the boot and my feet stayed dry. Arch support not that good. I had to get some foot bed inserts. Cons: Not that comfortable and takes a little while to break them in and even then still not that comfortable. Would not go on long hikes with these boots.
customer_reviews.author: s.montes

customer_reviews.title: BEST HIKING SHOE EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Best hiking shoe ever! This is finally my second pair I had about 2500 miles on the other ones and even though they were still study I just thought it was time for a new pair. Waterproof if amazing I've walked in the creek and they hold up great! If you ever have a problem KEEN will review and replace whatever it is that is causing a problem! Lot of support you don't feel the rocks beneath your feet ever! Great in snow with good traction.
customer_reviews.author: Mtngrl84

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking Boot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these Keen boots 3 weeks prior to our trip to Bryce and Zion National Parks last September. No "break in" time at all!! They were comfortable from the moment I placed them on my feet. I wear a women's size 7 but purchased a half size large to compensate for the thicker wool hiking sock I knew I'd be wearing and still, I had very little "sliding around" or other movement in the shoes. Traversed the narrow and rocky mountains steadily and with assuredness. I would highly recommend this boot for long hikes on paths or over rugged terrain!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Yanecek

customer_reviews.title: you never know if you get the lemon
customer_reviews.text: After reading all of the reviews...some were not very happy....I considered myself really lucky...until now.... My Keen Targhee II mid fits really well & is very comfortable to wear. However,..... the brown leather on both shoes are really scuffed up....never seen the likes of the condition that I got them in.....I know that they are not used by the condition of the bottom of the shoe & the inside of the shoe show no wear AT ALL....SO....my very 1st time....will it be my last time?
customer_reviews.author: C. Firebaugh

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a 9.5 and ordered a 10 - they fit perfectly. I did not know that hiking boots could be so comfortable! I found, unfortunately, that they are just too warm for casual wear, shopping, around the house, or summer wear. At least I know I have a great boot for actually hiking and for cooler weather.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: TOO SMALL VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 1/2 larger than my size they are too small. My feet are not wide, pretty normal. I've always bought my boots 1/2 size larger so I can fit an extra sock or a thicker one. I put them on, it lasts for about an hour, my toes rub against the boot and it kills.. The boot has not stretched a bit. I never complain, but for the price I have to be honest. I have also tried to adjust the laces and strap, nothing gives.
customer_reviews.author: Gee

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of these hiking boots that I love, but they’re starting to wear out. After trying on several different brands (couldn’t get the fit right) the minute I put these on and laced them up they felt like the perfect fit. I always order 1/2 size larger so I can fit winter wool socks on. I do agree with others in that these newer boots seem to have minor imperfections or flaws such as stitching that were never apparent in my older model of boots.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Can't Beat Keen Durability.
customer_reviews.text: I wore out my last Keens cleaning up after Hurricane Irma smacked my property. I had put a lot of mileage on them, even though I always had to wear thin socks with them. They were a 9.5, which is my typical shoe size. This time around I ordered a 10. They feel much better and I can wear a thicker sock with better wiggle room. I have had other Keens and have always found them to run ample in the width, but a little short. I'm sticking with 10 from now on. I'm always happy with the quality and durability of Keens.
customer_reviews.author: FLgardener

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended these. I figured I could return them if they didn’t feel or fit well. I was very pleasantly surprised. (I do recommend going 1/2 size larger.) The toe box is comfortable, which was one of my concerns. I have used them in the snow and look forward to this summer walks in the woods. I recommend them. The Targhee II mid waterproof boot.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoes right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I am walking on clouds. I have been wearing them for the past 2 hrs and walked about a mile. My feet feel great. No fatigue. Probably the best hiking shoes I have purchased. I used to wear Merrils, Vasque paid 300 dollars for some hiking shoes, These are so much better.
customer_reviews.author: da Vinci

customer_reviews.title: ... own 4 pair of these boots because of the excellent fit. Sadly the adhesive on two of these ...
customer_reviews.text: I own 4 pair of these boots because of the excellent fit. Sadly the adhesive on two of these pairs of boots have failed--- with the sole separating from the boot. As the boots are older than one year the company will not do anything about it. With adhesive failure I can no longer recommend this company's shoes. Second pair leaks, Third pair the hook broke and Keen doesn't have replacement hooks.
customer_reviews.author: william bultas

customer_reviews.title: Fit just right
customer_reviews.text: Got these for the high top as most of my hiking is in gravel and rocks get into my shoes which of course is such a nuisance but with that being said, I still get rocks inside my shoes but not as much as regular tennis shoes...Oh well, these boots are the most comfortable shoes for walking and hiking. I'm normally a size 11 which is the size I got and it's a perfect fit!
customer_reviews.author: JEC1

customer_reviews.title: Just ordered my 2nd pair.
customer_reviews.text: Great hiking boot. Just ordered my second pair. Have been wearing the first pair for 4 months every weekend hiking, but with a hard foot to fit - I decided to buy another pair. I wear a women's size 8 wide and ordered an 8 medium. I have a wide foot, a narrow heel, a high instep and high arches. There is room for my bio-sole gel OTC insole (best OTC insole). They fit perfect. Lots of room in the toe box. Very comfortable. With most shoes I feel pressure on the top because of my high instep, but not these. Happy :) !
customer_reviews.author: C. Joachim

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking boots ever
customer_reviews.text: I tried other hiking boots and always had to send them back because the fit was uncomfortable but these boots (my second pair now) are the best and they last forever. My first pair, which I am now rotating with my new pair, have seen me over hundreds of miles in the past 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best boots for arch support and dry feet
customer_reviews.text: Best boot ever, this is my third pair. I have plantar fasciitis but dislike using orthotics. None needed with these boots. I wear them to work daily. I wore them for five months in Alaska and also Cleveland winters and never got wet feet. I bought this pair to put away until my current pair wears out-just in case they get discontinued. Never want to be without.
customer_reviews.author: katwain

customer_reviews.title: GREAT boot
customer_reviews.text: These have turned out to be my favorite footwear. They are very warm and waterproof, and have good grip on all terrains when hiking. Another reviewer mentioned not having to break them in - not exactly true for me, but VERY glad I purchased them. I have added a little insert for additional arch support to my individual needs. I wear these every chance I get!
customer_reviews.author: akbill

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, ample toe space, no break in required!
customer_reviews.text: I have flat feet and bunions, so buying a hiking shoe has been no easy feat! But this should hopefully be a thing of the past with the KEEN Targhee shoe. I wore them for a moderately long hike and never felt more comfortable! While they do look and feel bulky, there is ample space for toes, relatively good ankle support, great traction, and didn't need to be broken into! My usual size is 8.5, but I recommend a half size up for greater comfort.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: I was happy then disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I used these to walk the distance on mostly flat roads and paths that did not have sidewalks. Never touched a mountain or hiked on an incline and within a month the toe part that is elastic ripped. I can’t believe I spent so much money on these for them to rip so quick.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, go half a size up
customer_reviews.text: Great boots! Definitely follow the recommendation to go half a size up, I bought both sizes and ended up returning the pair that would have been my regular size. They are warm on your feet, but, that is to be expected with waterproof boots. Can’t wait to take them out on the trail!
customer_reviews.author: Siggygal

customer_reviews.title: Not good for value
customer_reviews.text: Tried these and $80 Columbia boots (at the time of purchase these cost over $100) and these are simply poorly made and highly marked up. I’ve has Lena before, a different model when I was on and off boats a lot, and they basically fell apart. They’re comfortable but don’t last, like they’re glued together in parts where they should be sewn. If these were s lot cheaper they’d be worth it but I wouldn’t pay more than maybe $40 for these.
customer_reviews.author: Weona

customer_reviews.title: I hike the Rockies, and I prefer Keen.
customer_reviews.text: Finding the right hiking boot depends on the hiking terrain and hiking style. I have tried other brands and best fit for me is Keen. This is my 4th pair, I buy my true shoe size and they fit well. Of the different Keen styles, I like the feel of the Targhee II mid boot best. I hike over 1000 miles a year, thru rain, sleet and snow, never had issues with the waterproofing.
customer_reviews.author: KK Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Keen on Keen
customer_reviews.text: I love my boots. They fit perfect. I bought a half size up to accommodate for swelling and wool socks. I wore them all day out of the box and they were completely comfortable. I don't think I'll need a breaking in period after all!
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne DeWitt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent water proofing, stylish and well made
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. Excellent water proofing, stylish and well made. The thing I didn't like about them is that they don't come in half sizes so I had to get an 8 instead of a 7.5 because of this they're a little roomy at the toes but wearing thick socks should fix that. Also they make my feet look a little big. I'm a small person so it's noticeable to me. Maybe just me though. They are a little stiff too. I hope there's more flexibility once they get worn. Overall great boots!
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Riley

customer_reviews.title: The recommendation from others who have worn these boots and they DO NOT cause blisters.
customer_reviews.text: I am using my Keen women’s hiking boots for construction work. They are very comfortable to wear and are a great safety boot. I love really like the thickness and the way the sole is made. I don’t have to worry about nails penetrating into my feet. They are not a heavy boot to wear and they give great protection for the ankles. I also plan to wear my Keen women’s Targhee I Mid Wp-w Hiking Boots for all my hiking adventures in the future. Keen boots game highly recommended by a few of my friends who have had a couple pair of them.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Francis

customer_reviews.title: No cushion in the sole!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something very similar to some Merrils that I had where they were very sturdy yet cushioned. My own fault for buying on line so close to the event when I needed these but I has to buy insoles to make these shoes tolerable. Also, they mention in many reviews that they run large so I got a half size larger but they were a little too big. The added insole (usually take out the one it came with but did not) helped some. I am disappointed that I have to keep them because I needed and wore them that day. If they were the proper size and had a better insole I would have loved them.
customer_reviews.author: Byrdsmom

customer_reviews.title: These boots are great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots online based on the other user reviews (mainly the reports of how comfortable they are to the extent they didn't need a break-in period). I'm glad I ordered the size as I did as they're the perfect size (true to size of the boots I already own) AND the boots ARE extremely comfortable. I walked around the house with them on but the trip I'm using the for is in the future, so I haven't tried them on the trail. I'm going someplace that could experience a lot of rain, so I was specifically looking for a waterproof boot that offers ankle support. I recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna I. Sava

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and wide!
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots. I got them for their touted waterproof capabilities as I'm about to deploy with the Red Cross for Disaster relief following the hurricanes. I feel confident these will do the job! I'm normally an 8.5-9 & my toebox area is somewhat wide, but bought these in an 8.5 and they're perfect!
customer_reviews.author: JenInTn

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable. Just so darned comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I could LIVE in these hikers!! People ask about them, and I tell them they won't be disappointed. They fit perfectly right off the bat, they don't hurt and I don't get foot fatigue. Warm, waterproof, excellent traction. And they're soooooooo lightweight!
customer_reviews.author: S. Neumann

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots!!!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are fantastic. I am a huge fan of the Keen boots and shoes and these did not disappoint. They required zero breaking in. I wore them hiking on Mt. Rainier literally right out of the box. Our first hike was 9 miles over very rugged terrain and our second was 8 miles on the same. They were awesome. No blisters, no foot fatigue. I highly recommend. I just can't say enough about these boots. If you are considering buying these boots, do it. It will be the best thing you will ever put on your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Smith

customer_reviews.title: Feet never hurt!
customer_reviews.text: Just breaking them in....will use them for work this spring. Wore out my last pair because I work at a nursery and walk about 7 miles a day. Feet never hurt! My old pair came apart at front right toebox after about a yesr!
customer_reviews.author: melinda

customer_reviews.title: did not hurt my feet at all and actually felt good on my feet
customer_reviews.text: First pair of Keen's I've ever bought. I have a high arch, so I researched Keen to see which one's would support that. These did well. I also have a wide foot, and there was plenty of room in the toe. The first time I put them on, I hiked 4.1 miles, then went to grocery store afterwards, and had no problems, did not hurt my feet at all and actually felt good on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable from the moment I put them on
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable from the moment I put them on. Waterproof, but surprisingly lightweight. The shape of the boot, the stiffness of the sides, and the grip of the sole make for great hiking over rough terrain like slippery tree roots, slick clay rock and pointed stones. The heel is snug with no slipping around inside, but my toes can spread at the front. I LOVE these boots! Keens are great shoes and boots for wide feet. I normally wear a size 8, but go 1/2 size larger in a hiking boot so I can fit my wool socks in for warmth. This 8 1/2 M fit my somewhat wide foot perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Christiann

customer_reviews.title: I hiked 55 miles in the Rockies with excellent comfort and grip
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews, but these boots served me so well I had to sing some praises. After just a few miles of break-in, I hiked 55 miles in the Rockies with excellent comfort and grip, and no blisters or hot spots. They never got wet, so I can't speak to the waterproofing. Sizing was tricky: I have a wide foot and high arch, and wear an 8.5 in dress shoes, a 9 in running shoes, and a 40 European size. I debated between the Targhee 9 and 9.5, finally deciding on the 9.5 after I compared the insoles to those in my tried and true running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: CLW

customer_reviews.title: Durable, water resistant, comfy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size and a half larger cuz my feet swells. No more bumping my toes on descent. No calluses. I have room to out on two pairs of socks. I use the running socks with toes like gloves so no calluses or black toes or blisters. Always order sizes larger.
customer_reviews.author: alhal22

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Targhee II hikers, and what I received is *not* what was pictured in the Amazon listing OR what I own. The cut is different, there's no top lace anchor, the toe guard is shorter, and the ankle opening is wider. The photo on the listing is identical to my original Targhee IIs, but the pair I got looks like the Targhee III, which is a cheaper model. This will be the last time I buy something like this from Amazon - I'd rather go straight to the manufacturer, even if it's more expensive. At least they'll get it right.
customer_reviews.author: Disneyfile

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Have been wearing these boots for just over a week. I work in a warehouse and walk about twelve miles a day so needed a pair of boots that would be comfortable, provide ankle support and last for a while. There was zero break in period which was fantastic. These boots are lightweight and very comfortable. If I have one complaint it is that the laces are just a tad too short. I like to double knot them to make sure they stayed tied and the laces are about two inches too short to easily do this.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl A. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a really bad back and also live in a wet rural area. What I needed was a comfortable, lightweight, waterproof boot that had good traction and support so I could go for walks regardless of the weather. There's nothing worse than trying to get some exercise and feeling like you're trying to walk with weights on your feet. That makes for a really short walk with a bad back. These boots are everything I wanted and are so comfortable I could wear them daily.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Carter

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid hiker, I've always worn keen's and love them. I was hoping that the other reviews I read on these not being waterproof were a one off but unfortunately these are not waterproof. Was out on a hike and walked through a 1/2 inch of water, my socks got soaked. I missed my return window so I guess these are now my summer hiking shoes when no water is involved.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love Keens
customer_reviews.text: I work for Amazon in a fulfillment center as a picker. So I walk close to 10 miles a night. I have had great experiences with Keens in the past so I decided to try these. Nothing else was keeping my poor feet from wanting to fall off in retaliation from their workouts. Now I can take a 12 hour shift without wanting to amputate my own feet in order to not feel their pain. I highly suggest these!
customer_reviews.author: DaniH55

customer_reviews.title: The very best purchase I made for Iceland
customer_reviews.text: Wore these all day, every day in Iceland for 8 days over Thanksgiving. We went on 4 Northern Lights tours that went well past midnight, so temps were freezing. My feet never got cold one time (assuming you are wearing appropriate socks too). We did different outdoor excursions almost every day, which often included mud, ice, water, snow, hiking and freezing temps. The grip was great and they’re super comfortable, even without a chance to break them in. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: kylah s edgin

customer_reviews.title: Instant Comfort
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult for me to find shoes that fit, due to a high arch and high instep. I found these KEENs about 6 years ago, and was pleasantly surprised by its immediate good and comfortable fit. Usually I suffer through some chafing and blisters with new shoes, but not with these KEENs. When my pair finally started to fall apart after much intense use, I was happy to find that this style was still for sale. I was a little apprehensive that the design might have changed a bit, but the few small design changes did not result in any discomfort. So I immediately put them on and started walking on them!
customer_reviews.author: Irene Frentz

customer_reviews.title: Done with Keen - expensive mediocrity
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Keen Targhee II Mids for years now, and I've come to the realization they're a mediocre boot at best. They used to have a little better fit. I wear them 12-13 hours a day 4 days a week for work. They don't hurt my feet and provide ok support. I don't have any major foot issues though. The thing I've come to realize is that they're just not worth the high price, which is why I buy whatever color is on sale. They're not goretex so my feet are hot and sweat in them. They're not waterproof. They're not made in the USA. This pair will be my last.
customer_reviews.author: ss

customer_reviews.title: Their wide enough! Hurray!!
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and chew thru two pairs of boots every year. I’ve been buying the same brand for years (National brand that rhymes with Keen) with the quality and fit declining with each regurgitation. Damn I wish I’d tried these decades ago. These boots weren’t even their wide width and they feel like old friends!
customer_reviews.author: HattieHikesalot

customer_reviews.title: comfort right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Unlike many high end boots... Keens don't need to be "broken in"....you can wear them comfortably right out of the box!!! I wear them for years until they literally wear out... and then I buy a new pair. They are my GO TO shoes for everything!!!
customer_reviews.author: Agape

customer_reviews.title: I'd Buy Them Again
customer_reviews.text: And I did! This is the second pair of KEEN Women's Targhee II Mid Waterproof Hiking Boots that I have purchased for my daughter. When we were hiking a couple of weeks ago, I told her that it looked like she could use a new pair of hiking boots. She said that she wished she could get another pair of the exact ones she had as they were really comfortable and truly waterproof. I'm so glad they are still available.
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Great for long & serious hikes!
customer_reviews.text: These boots were a great investment. Since purchasing them, I've hiked through White Sands NM, the Guadalupe mountains, many places in California, the grand canyon, yellow stone, yosimite, a few parks in Utah & Colorado lots of places in Puerto Rico - all in these hiking boots. Hikes have ranged from 2 hours - all day. They hold up SO well. They are easy to clean, dry well, keep their support and cushion and work just as well as the day I bought them. They didn't require a break in period. Like most hiking shoes, I purchased 1/2 a size up & they fit perfect. Love these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Ashattack365

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a 7 in heels and 6 in flip flops but I ordered an 8 so my feet would have room to swell, and spread as I'm on my feet all day. This shoe is also wider and doesn't squeeze my feet. The larger size also gives my toes room and doesn't bump the edge of the inside when I walk.
customer_reviews.author: dixie

customer_reviews.title: Walked 10,000 miles in the last identical pair!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair 5 years ago - hiked to Chirripo, highest point in Costa Rica, and various volcanoes, hiked up Snowdon in the UK and wore them on two treks in Nepal including Everest Base Camp. Finally I had to admit that they were the worse for wear and weren't giving me the support and comfort I needed. Bought an almost identical pair because after all those miles, I have to say they are THE best hiking boots ever. Sturdy, comfortable, great support, and last and last and last.
customer_reviews.author: Brit in Asheville

customer_reviews.title: Solid structure and design
customer_reviews.text: A friend turned me onto Keen and since I'm off to Scotland in May, I thought these shoes would be perfect for all the hikes and sightseeing. They look even better in person and the fit is dreamy - I have a wide upper foot and most shoes and boots kill my pinky toes - not an issues with these! The toe portion is oversized (probably for better balance) and my feet feel great in them. The insole is great too, but I'll still be bringing supports just in case. I'll update after the trip to let you know how well they performed! Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SOOOO COMFORTABLE, but don't last well
customer_reviews.text: These are so comfortable and breathable that I buy a new pair every year, but it is annoying that they fall apart after just one year of use. As a gardener, I do wear them every day except in winter, but they don't get particularly abused. This year the seams came apart at the front on both sides of both feet, probably at 10 months. Again, this is after about 8 months of continuous use.
customer_reviews.author: CoastIris

customer_reviews.title: What's the point of water proof shoes if your feet sweat constantly?
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long term Keen customer and bout two pairs of these as shoes as they were on sale. But I've had a major issue with them, they don't breath AT ALL and as a result I've gotten heat trash on my feet from them. My feet sweat constantly in these- it's so frustrating and at times painful. Not worth the water proofing or money. So bummed - as I have never had this issue with the many pairs of Keen shoes I bought over the years.
customer_reviews.author: M_monster

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: These boots were just what I was looking for. I have a pair of Keen shoes so I was hoping they would be the correct fit for my feet. I have tried on 30 more hiking boots on and even though they were listed as wide they still didn't fit right. They are comfortable enough to wear all day.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had these boots for less than three months and they’re already coming and unstitched and I have not even hiked in them. I have just worn them for five or six times around the town. Very disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hawk

customer_reviews.title: I tell everyone, "I love my KEENS!
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and usually buy a size up if I can't find wide shoes. I had a pair of these for 5 years before they wore out. These are the only brand I will ever buy again
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: and they were wonderfully comfortable and supportive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this boot for a specific event; I expected to be walking for a considerable distance. I'm prone to blisters and bunions and generally sore feet, but this boot fit right out of the box with no break-in time -- thank goodness! The very first time I wore it I walked longer and further than I'd planned. The boots were on my feet for sixteen straight hours, and they were wonderfully comfortable and supportive.
customer_reviews.author: K. Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, great boot all around!! Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are the most comfortable hiking boots I've ever owned. I will not go back to another brand. No blisters, they're lightweight yet rugged. I've had multiple surgeries on both my feet and these shoes keep my feet very happy while hiking quite a few miles in the forest on a weekly basis.
customer_reviews.author: EMorton

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable, great traction, best hiking shoe!
customer_reviews.text: After reading all of the reviews I decided I had to give these a try and just like everyone said....right out of the box they are comfortable. The 2nd time I wore them we did some pretty intense rock climbing and these shoes never slipped, didn't give me blisters and where very comfortable. They offer enough ankle support to keep your ankle from turning but are not too high on the ankle to cause discomfort. AWESOME SHOE!!!
customer_reviews.author: AMA

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and great ankle support
customer_reviews.text: One week after I bought these shoes, I went hiking with my daughter to Bryce Canyon, Zion, Moab and Valley of Fire (State Park). We walked on snowy, icy, muddy rough trails. I walked with these shoes just twice before the trip, however, they were very comfortable throughout the hike and provided very good support for my ankles. I bought a half size bigger than my usual size since I was wearing pretty thick woolen socks.
customer_reviews.author: Terri T.

customer_reviews.title: Ready for Scotland!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't worn them all day yet, but I've worn them several hours at a time, and they're very comfortable. I got them well in advance of a planned trip to Scotland so I'd have ample time to wear them in. I don't think they're going to give me any trouble at all. I'm glad they're a little roomy, as I can wear different weight socks, depending on the temperature. They can be tied tight enough that my foot doesn't slip, as I was afraid it would, as I have a fairly narrow heel and often have that problem with shoes. I'm very well pleased with these boots!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn H. Piepmeier

customer_reviews.title: These are great boots! I got the black and red ones ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots! I got the black and red ones purely because they were slightly cheaper and in my size - those colors are ok, but not as nice as some of the other color combinations. However, a few days of hiking and getting covered in dirt and they honestly look much better! The black leather is now a lighter brown, haha! But honestly, these are great hiking boots that are pretty light, have decent ankle support but still offer flexibility, and I had no problem with them in dry summer heat.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love them.can wiggle toes, well protected, wear to work on concrete and walk all day. They make your feet a little warm but could just be I have hot feet. I am a chubby one and they hold up all my tender bits long past 10 hour days. And they cute.
customer_reviews.author: Amazmelanieon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These boots are made for walking...
customer_reviews.text: Order one size larger for best fit. I am normally a size 9 dress shoe and size 10 in these boots fits perfectly. My daughter and I have both walked hundreds of miles of the Camino de Santiago in these boots with no blisters. They require almost no time to break in and are very durable and waterproof. The wide toe box leaves lots of room for the toes- no rubbing. Something about their design seems to make it easier to walk and they are comfortable for everything from local walks to hiking mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love Keen hikers. The water resistant quality, solid structure, good grip, and nice looking. I had one pair once come apart at a seam but otherwise can't seem to wear them out or down. I usually wear a 9.5m but order Keens in a 10 and they seem to fit consistently good. I have two pair I alternate wearing around the ranch. Also have a pair or casual events.
customer_reviews.author: fun

customer_reviews.title: Inner soul weirdness.
customer_reviews.text: Love Keen boots. I hike and work in rugged areas. They only thing I found a bit strange with these is in the inner soul.. the outside edge seems to have an arch support instead of the inside in the arch of the foot. It turns the foot arch down which leads to foot fatigue. 95% of why I buy Keens is that my feet are not fatigued after wearing them 12 to 16 hours. I had to get and insert for the arch just for this pair. This is my 9th pair of Keens. I've not had this experience before.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

product_meta.title: KEEN Women's Targhee II Mid Waterproof, Gargoyle/Caribbean Sea, 9 M US
product_meta.description: From beaches to mountains to city streets, Keen believes the outdoors is anyplace without a ceiling. Keen believes in living a HybridLife, which means being part of a greater community that is full of people who create possibilities, play in the outdoors and care for the world around them.
feature_bullets: Care- To treat day to day wear and tear, especially on lighter color leathers, we recommend using a leather cleaner and conditioner, found at most footwear dealers and/or shoe repair shops
